intro: Polyactis, commonly known as the common thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their spiny leaves and showy, composite flower heads that typically range in color from white to purple. They are native to various regions across Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and many species have adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions. Polyactis species often thrive in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. Their ecological role includes providing food for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
